parsed.internal_thinking: Analyzing the board for the first settlement. Alice has taken Node 20 (11-6-8: Wood-Brick-Sheep, 12 pips). Bob has taken Node 42 (9-5-9: Wheat-Ore-Wheat, 12 pips). My goal is to secure high-yield nodes that provide a balanced resource base. Node 12 is the strongest available node with 11 pips, providing Wood (3), Brick (6), and Sheep (5). This gives me the best Brick source on the board (Hex 5). Since I'm the third player in a 3-player game, I will have the opportunity to place my second settlement immediately after this one (snake draft: A-B-C-C-B-A). For my second settlement, I'll target a Wheat/Ore heavy spot like Node 44 (6-9-2: Wheat-Wheat-Ore, 10 pips) to complement the Wood/Brick/Sheep from Node 12. This strategy ensures I have all five resources with high-probability numbers (6, 9, 5, 8, 3). [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Placing first settlement at Node 12. Planning second settlement at Node 44 to secure Wheat and Ore. Bob has a strong Wheat/Ore start, so I need to compete there. Alice has Wood/Brick/Sheep, similar to my first spot.
parsed.say_outloud: Hey everyone! Those are some solid spots. Alice, that 6-8-11 is definitely a powerhouse, and Bob, you've got the wheat market cornered already! I think I'll settle down in the forest near that 6-brick—looks like a good place to start some construction.
